issue.title: Repository request: mlkem-c-embedded
issue.body:
I'd like to request the following PQCP repository:

**Name**: mlkem-c-embedded
**Description**: This library provides a MLKEM implementation optimized for embedded microcontrollers. The library will have both stack optimizations and speed optimizations for 32-bit platforms. The first goal is to take the state-of-the-art Cortex-M4 implementations (in [pqm4](https://github.com/mupq/pqm4) ) and turn them into portable production-grade Apache-2.0-licensed implementations. Where needed (inline-)assembly will be added to achieve best performance while keeping the generic portable implementations as an option. In the long term, the goal is to optimize for more 32-bit platforms. Obvious choices would be 32-bit RISC-V (e.g, [HiFive1](https://www.sifive.com/boards/hifive1-rev-b))  or any of Arm Cortex-M3, Arm Cortex-M7, Arm Cortex-M55, Arm Cortex-M85. It will depend on contributors which platforms will be considered.

**License**: ~MIT~ Apache-2.0
**Access**: 
 - Admin: @mkannwischer 
 - Maintainer: @mkannwischer 
 - Core contributors: @mkannwischer [@potsrevennil](https://github.com/potsrevennil)

**Existing code**: https://github.com/mupq/pqm4 based on https://github.com/pq-crystals/kyber/tree/standard (However, the license situation in pqm4 is not ideal, so I do expect that we'll have to reimplement certain parts to be able to license everything under Apache-2.0.)

**Call for contributors**: We are looking for co-maintainers and contributors to help drive this library forward. If you are interested, please reach out to me!

comment.body:
Thanks @planetf1!

> 
> * Would your proposal change at all if the pq crystals kyber reference implementation were also onboarded (as we hope)? I'm thinking in terms of reuse?

No, not immediately. It makes sense to coordinate to possibly allow some code sharing in the future. But I'd see this as low priority.

> * How would you want to start the repository

We'd start with a copy of the Kyber reference implementation, add a buildsystem for the Cortex-M4 (e.g., the STM32F407G-DISC1), add some basic tests and benchmarks, and apply the stack and speed-optimizations using C for as much as possible.
The goal would be to have something functional by tomorrow night and a list of issues of the tasks left that we can work on over the coming weeks.

> * A full or partial repo move from pqm4 -- this will need more discussion. I think it comes down to whether you need/want/can preserve history. I'd err on keeping the new repo fresh.

No, it does not make sense to move the repo.
This is only going to be a very small part of pqm4, and I'd like to keep the licenses much cleaner than in pqm4.
This means we will have to rewrite quite a bit of code in there and at the same time will try to write portable code rather than M4-specific assembly whereever possible.

issue.title: Repository request: mlkem-rust-libcrux
issue.body:
I'm requesting the following PQCP repository:

**Name**: mlkem-rust-libcrux
**Description**: This library provides a portable ML-KEM implementation with some optimisations for AVX2. Full AVX2 support will be added over the coming months. The code is formally verified for panic freedom, correctness, and secret independence in [F*](https://www.fstar-lang.org/) using the [hax](https://github.com/hacspec/hax) toolchain.

**License**:  Apache-2.0

**Access**:
* Admin: @franziskuskiefer 
* Maintainer: @franziskuskiefer 
* Core contributors: @franziskuskiefer @karthikbhargavan 
 
**Existing code**: https://github.com/cryspen/libcrux/tree/main/src/kem

**Call for contributors**: We are looking for co-maintainers and contributors to help drive this library forward. If you are interested, please reach out to me!

comment.body: I'll start on creating the repository/users as part of the hackathon activity.

issue.title: ML-KEM Test Vectors
issue.body:
This a request to create a repo for ML-KEM test vectors.
A potential source is https://github.com/C2SP/CCTV/tree/main/ML-KEM pending how the CC0 license check works out.

It is likely that there could multiple sources.

comment.body:
I think we need to resolve the CC0 license, also I note that repo currently doesn't have any license quoted.

Given that unknown, do we have any content we can (pending approval) put in a repo yet?

Still looking into it. I sent a note to Douglas and Sophie (who sent the vectors).
Her vectors are expected to be added in Wycheproof but  was unable to find a link.
